description: Inherited from Middle English juncture, from Latin iūnctūra. Doublet of jointure.

entries.meaning: A place where things join, a junction.

examples: We're at a crucial juncture in our relationship.

entries.meaning: (linguistics) The manner of moving (transition) or mode of relationship between two consecutive sounds; a suprasegmental phonemic cue, by which a listener can distinguish between two otherwise identical sequences of sounds that have different meanings.
